Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Tripwonder
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money spent compared with the other mainstream hotel chains. Very good location for Mississippi River, French Quarter and Amtrak. Plus most tour operators will pick you up at the hotel as well. If you need help, just ask and the staff responds to your requests!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: CathyAnne
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night in July. We had chosen this Best Western because we have never been disappointed by a Best Western hotel, and because we wanted a hotel close to the Harrah's casino so its location was perfect for us. You walk five minutes and you are at the Harrah's ! We found the area safe even late at night. Valet parking was easy and fast, and so very convenient. Front desk staff was OK, professional and pretty friendly. Our room was really very nice and comfortable, bathroom also. I just regret they didn't tell us at front desk that our room had no window, so we might have tried to get an other one. I am claustrophobic so that was a very unpleasant surprise for me. They knew it because I told them I don't use elevators, and asked for a room at a low floor (here they were very kind and did their best but couldn't help much as the hotel was pretty full so we got a room at the 6th floor). Well, the beds were very comfortable, so I finally managed to sleep ! Breakfast was OK, yet with average food, they could propose a wider variety. And the breakfast area is not very large, it was crowded when we came down and had a hard time finding a seat. Anyway, we'll definitively choose this hotel again next time we'll be in New Orleans. Very nice rooms, good price, and perfect location (just a few minutes drive - and very easy - to parking lots for French Market). I'll just remember the window problem next time !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Great City!!!”
Reviews.Author: thebutcherswife4
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this Best Western Plus, St. Christopher. I met a member of the staff outside as we were waiting to unload our suv. She was very nice and friendly and welcomed me to their hotel. I explained that my girlfriend and I were here to celebrate her birthday and that she had never been to New Orleans before. They made arrangements for us to have a room with a view of the Mississippi river. Very nice!! We stayed for 5 nights and did not want to leave! Our room was very nicely decorated, clean and quiet. And it had the old exposed brick wall from when it was a warehouse years ago, which a was neat touch. All the staff were very nice and they got to know us as we were going in and out several times in the day and night to explore the city. A special thanks to Rhonda for making our stay very special and memorable. :o) We will be back again and will stay at St. Christopher. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “St. Christopher Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shasta Y
Reviews.Content: I Loved the Hotel, it was Beautiful and the Staff was extremely helpful! The room was clean and a little larger than most in Down Town New Orleans. The only down side was the walk to the French Quarter. If You dont mind paying $$$ for a cab to and from the Quarter I say its a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Timothy N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on business. The rooms were very small but they were clean. I was a little upset that there was no microwave in the rooms. I stayed at a regular Best Western and they had both microwave and fridge. The location of this hotel was excellent. It was within walking distance to bourbon street. The breakfast was average. The regular Best Western had a better selection of breakfast than the one at this property. The front desk staff was great. I will be back again when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Check in before 5!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoJo30058
Reviews.Content: Hotel was kool...but I have to admit I didn't stay in it much. My room was 1009 and didn't have windows. Just a make shift one. I didn't care though. It has a safe and a NY style bathroom but with a very nice size shower. Very clean and pretty good internet service. The young lady that was there in the evenings (after dark) at the desk was just rude and dismissive to a couple of people I saw come in. She was like that with me too. I chose it because it's proximity to the french quarter. It's within walking distance to the french quarter and all food venues within. Tip...the continental bfast wasn't for me. There is a nice bfast spot right next door and a later night diner type spot two blocks down to the left. Look for the 'OPEN' sign. They have awesome wings. It was midnight when I ordered to go and several people were sitting and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with a major flaw.”
Reviews.Author: StÃ¥le Johan K
Reviews.Content: We totally loved the Best Western St.Chritopher Hotel. It was everything we ever looked for coming to New Orleans. But we had a very negative experience with the front office staff regarding our laundry. We had a desperate need to get some of our clothes washed. And was given a laundry bag in the reception, as it was missing in our room. I delivered it down the same night to the receptionist, and was told it would be ready the day after before 6. The day after there where no signs of our laundry, I thought maybe it had been delayed, and wasn't warned because we had a couple of more days to stay. The day after that, we are on the third day, I asked again. And they had found a bag in the back of the front-desk. And it was my laundry! unwashed! They called the laundry and ordered a speed pickup as i was listening. I was in a hurry because the day after was our check out day. They told me that it was going to go just fine. The next morning as we where checking out, I asked if my laundry had arrived. And they had the bag with my dirty laundry still sitting in the reception. As I said earlier, I would have given this hotel top rating, if it hadn't been for this terrible incident. The rooms where great, the bathroom large and spacious. Most of the staff was friendly.The breakfast was a little primitive, but OK. The location and surroundings great. Don't miss out on the Bon Ton Cafe just a few block away. I really recommend this hotel, if you don't have any dirty laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings.”
Reviews.Author: GrogQueen
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly and valet, although there was a wait, was fine. Let me say now, that we booked a room without a window. We knew this when we made the reservation. However...nothing prepares your brain for what it actually means to stay in a room without a window. Upon reaching the seventh floor we noticed filthy carpet in the hallways. Like all of the grime of Bourbon street had been building up on it for months. When we got into the room, I noticed that the carpet in here was not that much better and the bathroom floor looked as though it hadn't been mopped in weeks. The whirlpool tub was gross - all the jets were dirty looking. By the way, who takes a bath in hotels? That is so grody. Whirlpools suck all your dirty, and everyone's dirty into the pump and it just festers in there. Then when the next person gets in and turns the jets on, all that dirty gets pumped into your bath and swirled all around you. Sick! The shower pressure was great. It really helped blast all of the dirt, grime and sweat that one accumulates while roaming around NOLA in July. The linens on the bottom of the bed, that serve no other purpose than to either be decoration or to allow you to lay on the bed with your shoes on and to have somewhere to put your dirty feet besides the actual bed, were filthy with big blotchy stains on them. They immediately went on the floor over by the TV. One of our pillow cases was completely shredded. I'm not talking a few little holes here and there. Shredded. There's no way housekeeping didn't see it. You could see as much actual pillow as pillow case. My friend peeked behind the curtain covering a mirror window on the wall and scared herself because she saw one of our reflections in it. We laughed about it for a while, but as the weekend progressed, the windowless room became a bigger issue. We couldn't tell if it was light or dark outside, if it was raining or not, or if robot aliens were taking over the city. We would've been the last to know, because we had zero access to the outside world in that room. It really started bugging us, but never as much as it did very early the morning of our departure. For those of you that don't know, even the French Quarter has its limits. It's been a while since I've stayed out late enough to know this, but about 3-4 a.m., the NOPD drives their cars up Bourbon street with the lights flashing and the loudspeakers blaring with a message of - you don't have to go home, but you gotta get the h*ll out of here. So, it was about 4:15 when some of the hardcore fun seekers got back to the hotel. One person decided to slap the door of a nearby guest for about 15-20 minutes until finally I heard someone say [laughing] - hey man, I think you're on the wrong floor. Enter stage right, a girl who really wanted "Jay" to open the door to their? room. "Jay, open the door. Open the door Jay. Jay. Jay. Jay. Open the door." So about 4:45 I'm laying there thinking about the drunk action in the hallway and what if that progressed to some dangerous stuff and what if one of them dropped a cigarette or something and lit the floor on fire, and the hallway went up in flames? We would be in some deep you-know-what because there's no other way to get out besides the door! I started having a pretty good panic attack at that point. What I'm trying to tell you is, you might want to pay the extra bit of money the hotel charges to stay in a room with a window. OR - just stay at another hotel. A cleaner hotel. The continental breakfast, though it had lots of choices, was pretty blah. None of the choices were very appetizing to the 8 of us who stayed there. Try eating at Red Gravy a couple of roads over if you want some yummy fuel that'll help get you through the day. The location of the hotel is great. The people who worked there were nice. The valet situation, especially upon checkout is sort of obnoxious. We tried calling down for our car, but they couldn't hear us and we ended up waiting over half an hour for the car once we were down in the lobby with all our stuff. Oh and by the way - when you get your car from valet - in July - in NOLA - after they've been running all morning...it will smell like a valet that's been running all morning. In NOLA. In July. We had a fun trip. The windowless room was like being in an episode of The Twilight Zone - it altered reality a bit. The hotel was cheap for the area and we didn't spend that much time there. Get a window room.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep I've had in along time !!”
Reviews.Author: Ash0926
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We travel to New Orleans at least 5 times a year. The hotel we normally use was booked so we decided to try this one & I'm soo glad we did. Check in wasn't until 3. We arrived early & by 11:45 we got a call stating our room was ready. The room was very cozy & quiet. We are big fans of "windowless" rooms. We are often very busy & love to sleep in on vacation. The whirpool room was to die for !!! The beds & pillows are by far the best in NO. Slept like a baby. The room could of been cooler & the AC was a little noisy. My ONLY complaint was on checkout morning room service knocked at 8:30 I told them we were sleeping. They knocked again at 9:25,10:00,10:25 & 10:45. Our checkout wasn't until 11. But we went ahead and left bc she said she would wait outside our door for us to leave & I'm sure she had other rooms to clean. Checkout was a hot mess ! The lobby was full & it was raining. At least 50 people waiting for valet. But it was Sunday morning & it was handled in a timely manner !! Will be our first choice from now on. Easy & safe walk to & from French quarter !! Thank You :))

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, terrible housekeeping, incompetent valets: don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: njaa247
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a serious disappointment. I stayed here for a week while in town for work. Every interaction I had with the front desk was unpleasant, breakfast featured the world's worst and weakest coffee, the valets were polite but incompetent, and housekeeping left dirty coffee filters in the coffee machine and hair in the sink. My room had no windows (4 walls). To top it all off they surprised me with a ~$1 per day "safe charge" for a safe I never used, and when I asked if that could be removed they said it was "part of the taxes." I'm a very easy-going traveler but I will never stay here again. The location is nice, but there are plenty of other hotels in the area. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of your credit card guarantee with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelpro33480
Reviews.Content: This hotel billed my credit card as a no-show, even though I had cancelled the reservation within two minutes of making it and it was three days prior to scheduled arrival. When I spoke with the GM she offered me a 50% discount off their mistaken charge- not so great when (1) I owe them nothing to begin with and (2) the hotel should be apologizing to me for their error - not attempting to capitalize on it. The Best Western Plus St. Christopher Hotel has about the same guest service attitude as the county jail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in regards to walking to Bourbon Street & the Superdome. We were in NOLA for the Essence Music Festival & this hotel is 1 mile from the Superdome & less than that to Bourbon St. The rooms are small, liked the queen better than the king. You can barely move around the knig room once your suitcases are on the stands.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; great service.”
Reviews.Author: JudyB586
Reviews.Content: Right around the corner from French Quarter. Front desk staff was extremely accommodating and helpful; we came early and they watched our luggage until check-in time so we could enjoy the city. Nice breakfast. Our room was on the 9th floor; had a window and was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: redtruffle56003
Reviews.Content: Good location: close enough to French Quarter but not right inside with the noise. The room is quite small but clean and updated. There was a jacuzzi tub in our bath which was a pleasant surprise. Our room was an interior room and had no real window except for a fake window with mirror and curtain over it. The AC was very loud all night. There was tons of food in the continental breakfast buffet and the pancake machine was fun and the pancake decent. The valet parking service was speedy but it does cost $20.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Ms G
Reviews.Content: Management at this hotel and the way they and corporate failed to handle my room complaint fairly has inspired me to cancel my Rewards membership. My next stay in New Orleans will be at the Omni or the Sheraton. Best Western is no longer on my list of preferred hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: june813
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for JAZZ Fest. The location is close to the French Quarter but the service was lacking. The hotel was out of shampoo but did have conditioner, the maid service became a point of harassment in the morning knocking at the door to clean the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Iamabozo
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was geat. The room was clean, quite and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No smiles from the desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Bexjex
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff could use retraining, they do not know how to smile or be helpful, they did not let housekeeping know we were staying a day longer, they then implied it was the fault of housekeeping. They did not renew our door keys when we extended. House staff and dining staff could teach them a thing or two.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location adjacent to quarter”
Reviews.Author: Vcoughlin
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people are talking about when they say the front desk staff was indifferent. They were extremely helpful to me and my husband in picking out tours, making calls for us to the tour companies, getting our car, always welcoming us, etc. The location was perfect, just across the street from where the French quarter starts. Trust me, you don't want to be inside the quarter unless you are on a bachelor/bachelorette party, unless you are on royal street(quiet,artsy). All in all, a good hotel and a good price and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Attitudes at the desk and a noisy sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: jasminefree
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews of varying opinions about this hotel before I booked my room. I wish I would've gone with the ones that said don't stay here! One of the front desk clerks was terribly rude. When we went to the desk she didn't speak or really acknowledge us at all. I asked her to call a cab for me. She walked over like we were bothering her but picked up the phone. We couldn't really hear what she was saying on the phone but after a minute or two of talking she sat the phone back down and walked away. Never even bothered to tell me if she had actually called and asked for a taxi. Very rude and unprofessional! Then later that night as we were trying to sleep, there was another guest on our floor blaring a tv. About 2:30am I called the front desk and asked for them to send someone to our floor and try to figure out where the sound was coming from but I guess they never did because the noise continued all night. The only positive thing that I can say about this hotel is that it is close to all of the tourist attractions. I will never stay at this hotel again however. I feel like if I'm going to spend $ 250 plus dollars a night on a room then at least the employees can be friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indifferent reception staff”
Reviews.Author: timothymarkwebb
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly housekeeping staff and the guy who looks after the bags and taxis is a star and true gentlemen. Room size is good and nice exposed brickwork. Bathroom was clean and large enough. I had to pay a daily supplement for the safe and even though it didn't work i had to pay it. I raised this and one of the ladies on reception, Renada, was just uninterested. She was also as uninterested when I checked in. Aside from her the visit was fine. Its no W or Hyatt but does the job. Breakfast is acceptable but does the job. I wouldn't stay here again but at short notice or on a budget it gets my approval.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, nothing horribile, good service, great morning coffee”
Reviews.Author: Norman_Luxury_Yacht
Reviews.Content: This was my budget choice for a downtown hotel during a convention. The location was perfect. Everything was clean. The staff was accommodating. It did have the best morning coffee (free) of any budget hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is positioned almost halfway between everything which makes it nice. It's a 10 min leisure walk to the French quarter or the river walk or the museums. The beds are comfortable. Top floors are the only ones with views but the 10th floor is smoking. The continental breakfast surprised me. It includes fresh banannas, apples, oranges, boiled eggs, string cheese, muffins, bagels, waffles, cereals, yogurt, sausage and biscuits, juices, teas, coffee, milks and more. The hotel is older so things aren't sparkly but they are clean. Overall I was impressed. I would not pay more than 150 a night for the hotel though as they are other places around for cheaper. Tip: meters for parking are always off (meaning free) from 6pm to 6am every night and all day Sundays. I pay to park because I stay for a week usually and don't want to worry about it but if your staying for just one night then park on the street versus paying valet

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Susan T
Reviews.Content: Just on the edge of the french quarters we had the best time here. Rooms not very big but comfortable and clean. Staff excellent and very helpful. Breafast was fantastic. Would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Lucybelle1
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference and did not want to stay too close to the convention center so we can walk to the French Quarter. It is about 15 minutes walking distance to first and 10-15 to the latter. The hotel is very well kept and very clean. The front staff was very attentive and helpful when asking for directions and suggestions. There is valet parking but we did not use it. Breakfast was OK (some yogurth, pastries, fruit and coffee but no scramble eggs or potatoes... or anything that caught my attention and ended up having breakfast somewhere else twice after 5 days). The hotel rooms have a small fridge that came in handy several times. The rooms are average and thought that the bathrooms were a little small (though my in laws got a bigger one with a jetted tub). Avoid the 2nd floor (just above the breakfast area, where you can hear everything) and the 10th floor if you are not a smoker! It was much cheaper than comparable places and even cheaper with my wife's military discount.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a budget choice in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: alam1
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and wanted an inexpensive place to stay. The location can't be beat. It is just on the edge of the French Quarters, and only 15 minutes to the convention center and the waterfront. Maybe it was because I came in late or I paid the lowest price (I booked through discounter Otel.com), I was given the worst room in the house. Avoid the second floor at all cost, esp 204 and 205. These 2 rooms are right over the busy breafast area and noisy lobby. By 5 30 AM or so the workers were already getting ready for breakfast and you can hear it all in the room above. 204 and 205 also have very little natural light. These 2 rooms should never have been made into guest rooms. No one in his right mind would stay in these rooms. I complained and was moved to the 10th floor and given a smoking room (nothing left in the hotel and I didn't smoke). Here almost everything was better, incl lots of light and quiet. Bed also felt firmer. The room and hallway had a smokey and musty smell and the windows can't open. The free breakfast was just adequate. Most of it was processed, rich and unhealthy. Advantages-The staff was friendly and the room price was cheap. Location also perfect. I wouldn't stay here if I came with my spouse. Hotel seems to attract big tour groups. Book it if you want something cheap, no frills, convenient but reasonably clean. Go somewhere else if you are staying with someone special.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: To Me The hotel was ok. I didnt like the hotel rooms,Because it had no window in our room.

Reviews.Title: “SEC Tourney!”
Reviews.Author: Kytbear
Reviews.Content: We came in for the SEC tourney and the hotel was very busy; however, the staff was always attentive and went above and beyond to make sure our room/stay was satisfactory. There were problems with the air conditioning but it was fixed immediately. When we realized the game started after our check out time, the hotel offered to hold our luggage and leave the car in valet parking until after the game. I highly recommend the hotel. We couldn't have been happier or better taken care of from hotel services to recommendations of places to eat to friendliness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise poor.”
Reviews.Author: Rodnight
Reviews.Content: Great location, but that's pretty much where it ends for me. My room, on the 4th floor, faced a brick wall. Breakfast extremely basic. Thin walls meant that I was woken every time the guy next door took a shower. Housekeeping poor and disinterested. No hand towels one day, no shampoo the next (despite my asking for some). Long queue at check-out. Good shower, but then maybe that's why it makes such a noise.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Emmanuelle B
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to brag about at the Christopher. However if you are on a budget looking for a clean and safe place to stay I recommend it. The staff is not the friendliest but they are very cooperative. Breakfast is included which is a big plus. Very Central Location, within walking distance of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Great Location. Excellent Choice.”
Reviews.Author: iamrennie
Reviews.Content: As a former resident & frequent visitor of New Orleans, I can safely say that this hotel is above average in all aspects. Perfect for a short stay or an extended visit. Unique & artful (tho somewhat smaller) rooms. Prime location. Safe & well lit area. Quiet rooms @ any hour! (not a common attribute in the quarter) The parking was about $25-$30 per day in a lot directly behind the hotel. It's not cheap, but about on par for parking in the quarter area. Nearly adjacent to the casino & riverwalk attractions. Just across the street from Bourbon & Decatur nite life, Royal Street shops, and several blocks from Frenchman Street. If you're looking for value, this hotel is worth the moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “good room and location”
Reviews.Author: Oceancreek321
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom as displayed on the hotel photos, adequate breakfast for free, waffles, cereals and microwave as well as pastries and fruit. Convenient location off canal street, with trolley and magazine street bus stop around corner from hotel and French Quarter opposite. Would book this hotel again if going back to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “2012 Trip”
Reviews.Author: Penguin613
Reviews.Content: Was surprised at the $28 for parking. Valet parking only. Be very carefull getting out of the car on the passenger side. You can get your door knocked off real easily. Was within walking distance to The House of Blues. Breakfast was ok. Ceral, waffles, bagels, toast, some fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: golfer082
Reviews.Content: This hotel is priced well compared to other hotels in the french quarter. It is on Canal Street, only one block from the quarter. We stayed for four nights and had no issues. The room is not the largest, but adequate for two people.The bed was comfortable, make sure to ask for a room with a window. Shower was great, lots of pressure. We had a small table and a couple of chairs. Not much room to hang clothes, but does have a chest of drawers. Only drawback was lack of countertop space in bathroom. Free breakfast is just fine in the morning. Book this place and save yourself some money. It is in a safe area and not all the noise of bourbon street, but only five minute walk away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: fallingleaf21
Reviews.Content: Booked the week of for a last minute trip to Mardi Gras last year. My friends and I were driving in from Houston and unfortunately could not reach the hotel for a little while because it is cut off by many of the parade routes. If you stay here for mardi gras I would definitely advise learning the parade schedule, etc to find out when or if its possible to get to the hotel. We had to park pretty far in a private pay lot and then walk with our luggage several blocks and then wait for the parade to be over for the night before getting to the hotel. I was a little irritated because I called the front desk for information on how to get there since all the streets were closed and they didn't seem to know. The hotel itself was pleasant and smaller. Like most hotels they had a strict guest only upstairs policy during mardi gras where you had to wear wrist bands throughout your entire stay. I was staying in a room with just 1 king size bed and it was very very small. There was maybe 3 feet extending out from the bed in all directions and not much more. Not that bad of a problem if you don't plan on staying in your room much. Sometimes the hotel staff at the front seemed a little inconsistent about some rules but I guess for such a hectic time of year they were doing their best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but breakfast wasn't.”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELGIRLS46561
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February during early Mardi Gras season. The hotel itself is very nice although a bit of a walk to Bourbon Street versus other hotels I've stayed at in New Orleans. Room was great, had free wi-fi and we were happy with room amenities. Only downside was continental breakfast. We had plans to leave early the morning of check out so we were just going to grab breakfast at hotel. Only problem was that the entire breakfast area including where the food was had gnats flying all around. I took a danish and sat down and the gnats followed me. Needless to say, we got up and left and walked down to breakfast at a different restaurant which we hadn't budgeted for financially so that was an added expense to the hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: This hotel like many is an old warehouse that has been converted. It is half a block off Canal Street and only like 4 blocks to Bourbon Street. The room is smallish but clean with great old floor to ceiling windows and a large bathroom that also had a large window. Convenient, reasonablly priced and free internet. Not a lot of frills but a great stay. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised when making last minute reservations..this was a clean room - very comfortable bed...cold air - great price - actually a bargain...I've stayed in higher priced hotels and the room wasn't any better Area recommendations the theatre/arts district was very nice, felt safe. I would stay just on the outskirts of the french quarter

Reviews.Title: “5 nights at best western st christopher”
Reviews.Author: mssurfcity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location right off canal st. Nice big room with floor to ceiling windows and a refrig. The staff at the front desk was cheerfull. the only drawback is their house keeping. They never cleaned the floors. The breakfast was nothing to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “i woke up covered in bug bites and a $170 hold on my account”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: the red cross set me up in this hotel after my apartment building caught on fire. After sleeping in the bed I woke up with welts all over my arm and torso. Its the first week of the month and they put a $30/night hold on my card, with out telling me, and when I checked out they added another $110 with out telling me. thanks guys its not like you could have gotten me nsf fees for my rent and bounced check fees for my bills. over all I am very disappointed in my stay there, the beds were comfortable but they bite!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Stagalv_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western St. Christopher in January 2012 for 2 nights. I got a bargain AAA rate of $98/night and was quite pleased with it overall. It's an old, historic building with exposed brick in the room and it has been nicely updated. I stayed in a room with a queen size bed on the 8th floor and had no issues. The free breakfast isn't anything to write home about but there was juice, coffee, pastries, fresh waffles, hard boiled eggs and cereal. * The main thing this hotel has going for it is the location. A few steps off of Canal St. and the Quarter is only a few blocks away. Well within comfortable safe walking distance. I would stay here again - especially for this rate.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster Averted”
Reviews.Author: JimF1935
Reviews.Content: Thirty minutes prior to checking in the hotel called to say that they were overbooked, but had a room for us on the New Orleans Westbank. I told the manager that this was not acceptable and she would have to find us another room. She called back in about 20 minutes and said to come on down to the hotel that they had found us a room. The hotel is very conveniently located one block from Canal St. in an old restored building. While our experience would have been rated "2" I gave it a "3". The staff turned out to be very accomodating and the location is excellent. The city could do a better job of maintaining the sidewalk between the hotel and Canal St.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Harrassment, Tiny Rooms, Appalling Service- And some weird deposit thing they do.”
Reviews.Author: Provida
Reviews.Content: I will preface this with the fact that I was violently ill with a stomach virus during my stay, so that could color my view, but some things are objectively true. First, the furniture was too large for the room, and I had to move chairs to make it functional. That's cool, though. I can handle "quaint"- but what I couldn't handle was the poor service and the harassment. Housekeeping insists on banging on your door and not leaving, demanding a signature on something even when you are naked and covered in germs. The Do Not Disturb sign DOES NOT WORK. They will knock and try to enter anyway. Even when I grabbed a blanket to cover myself and pulled off the Do Not Disturb sign and said to them, "What does this mean?" they still said I had to sign their stupid log. And- my credit card is still maxed out because they take your deposit off the card each day and supposedly refund it at the end of the stay. This has yet to happen. OH, PLUS, don't forget that the staff reminds you that although you are paying 4-star prices, you are in a motel 6 and you have to get your own bags. No bell service. Continental breakfast was also rather bleh. The whole stay, including being directed to a vending machine for toiletries, it was unpleasant at best. Stay elsewhere. The Astor across the street was a dream during my previous trip. Stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: sockitpet
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean but the service was lacking. The continental breakfast was adequate but not kept up by the staff in charge. The tables were rarely cleaned and the help didn't seem to care. The bartender was friendly and gave good advice on where to go and what to see during the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyskies99
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New Orleans for a long weekend. Due to flight times, I arrived at the hotel almost 5 hours before check-in, assuming I would just check my bag but the helpful staff was able to accomodate my early arrival and check me into my room. The room was great, large and clean with a great design (I love the exposed brick wall!) and also very quiet, since each floor only has a few rooms per wing. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom spacious. There was also a good free breakfast, including eggs and waffles. The location of this hotel is also fantastic. It is just a block from the French Quarter, so simple and quick to get to the fun stuff, without the noise and crowds of being directly in the district. It is only a few minutes walk to Bourbon St., Jackson Square, House of Blues, Shops at Canal Place, the Mississippi River Walk and Harrah's Casino. If you are flying into New Orleans and don't mind a $30+ cab ride, there is no need to have a car if you enjoy walking. I would definitely recommend this hotel! I was impressed with the price, especially for the location, and will definitely stay here again the next time I travel to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Several problems. Was promised a free night voucher, never received it”
Reviews.Author: MKUltra3340
Reviews.Content: This hotel holds the ENTIRE balance of your stay on your credit card. Keep that in mind if you are planning to stay here on your trip, as it could impact your budget. First, the PROS: Location is EXCELLENT. The hotel is just a few steps from Canal street; only a 2 min walk to the Canal St Trolley and within a couple blocks of St Charles Ave (take the trolley to the Garden District), Bourbon St and French Quarter. It is also a few minutes walk from the Casino. The rate was good and water pressure/temperature in the shower was excellent. My room (#408) was located VERY close to the elevators and vending machines, but I didn't hear a sound. CONS: The mattress was the WORST! I had to cut my stay short by 3 days prior to checking in, which I was disappointed about, but I am so grateful that happened because the mattress was totally spongy/springy and worn out. I spoke to the front desk clerk in the morning and asked if there was another room I could change to because the bed was awful. She acknowledged the mattresses are all old and because of that changing rooms wouldn't make a difference. No apology or offer to discount the rate was made, which surprised me. Not only was the mattress well beyond the point of needing to be replaced, the hotel uses cheap small "throw cushion" type pillows, and one of the pillowcases was filthy (see photo). I cannot imagine how a anyone could wash, dry, fold it and make the bed and not see the stain... it was also on the bottom side, obviously meant to hide it. On my second night I didn't get back from a business dinner until about 1am. When I entered the hotel, no one was at the desk. I went to my room and called the Front Desk. The man who answered the phone was extremely rude and cut me off mid-word with "What time do you want the wake-up call?" I excused myself and said that I wasn't finished speaking, and was calling to have the phone/clock replaced while I was out the following day in addition to the wake up call. He did not apologize for being so rude and interrupting me. The hotel has old tube TVs, and the sound/video on the TV in #408 is very fuzzy. (Although, if you're in New Orleans, why bother watching TV?!) I completed a survey emailed to me about my stay, and also emailed the hotel to outline these issues. I received a form letter with the subject line "DEEPEST SINCERE APOLOGY LETTER" (in caps in the original) from the manager, Tracy Collins, offering to mail me a voucher for free night at the hotel. I never received it.

Reviews.Title: “Value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chrisfield1983
Reviews.Content: We went on a boys holiday from the UK to New Orleans for voodoo weekend. The hotel was brilliant, loads of room in a twin, we had a shower/hot tub bath, it was clean but didnt have a window, the location was right in the edge of the french quater, close enough to experience it but far enough away not to keep you up at night. perfect place for friends and coulpes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: 50plustropicallover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to and after a cruise. Lori on reception was particularly friendly and helpful, with check in, helping us to store luggage after check out, calling cabs and giving us general information etc. A receptionist and bellboy on one. The hotel was in a great location with the attractions in the French Quarter within easy walking distance. We requested a room with a window which we were able to have. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable and we used their free wireless connection. A continental breakfast was provided at no extra cost, which was a nice touch. I loved the brick walls and the general ambience and feel of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Economical stay in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: jaymb49
Reviews.Content: During and very busy weekend in New Orleans, I was able to find a comfortable and affordable room with handicapped access. The room was clean and well cared for, though the hotel is not the newest on the block. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was within walking distance of the French Quarter so there was no need to rent a car. In spite of the noise on the street, the hotel was very quiet and suitable for those of us who actually want to sleep while in this fabulous city! When returning to New Orleans, I will be returning to St. Christopher's. No fancy spa or pool...just a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great quaint hotel in new orleans!”
Reviews.Author: klordh
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great staff. Very accommodating to us. We had a large lab and small poodle which were welcomed with open arms. Clean comfortable bed. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stuff went missing from our hotel room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ola90
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Our purchased sourveniers went 'missing' on the very last day of our stay. My husband bought a bag of New Orleans specific items for his three daughters. On the very last day we stayed there they went missing from our locked bedrooms. The maid cleaned the room that day and we came home late to find a whole bag of shopping completely gone. After going straight to the front desk to request that they phone the maid or immediately check the garbage they did neither. They said they would look into it. They knew we were flying out the next day at 6:30 a.m. We got back to Canada and left several messages. FInally we heard from management that they checked the bags and talked to the maids and that they believed the maid threw the bag away in error. Despite the fact that we provided photocopies of receipts showing our purchases, they did NOT refund the cost of the items, OR replace that which went missing. Sadly, his kids went without their items. They later mailed a gift certificate for a one night free stay at the hotel, which we advised was completely useless to us given that we live in Western British Columbia, Canada. We also had two other issues: on the first day we stayed there they undertook very noisy contruction directly above our room at eight in the morning. Hence, we requested a room change. AFter changing room there were two locked poodles in the neighbouring room that howled and cried for hours on end. Very unfortunate. Good location but not worth having stuff go missing - especially with a hotel that is unwilling to search for items before people fly out and rectify their own mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DavenAthens
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very helpful in any questions about recommendations for food places and were very helpful with the checking out, keeping our bags while we took a final tour of the French Quarters and having a cab ready when we returned. The rooms were nicely furnished and very comfortable beds. One room was a very nice size, the other a little smaller. A few carpet stains but everything looked clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel for girls trip”
Reviews.Author: Gigem89
Reviews.Content: It was hard to find a clean hotel with smoking rooms in the French Quarter so we opted to stay a block from the Quarter at the Best Western on Magazine street which was right across Canal Street into the quarter. We had no problems with the location and getting around. We valet parked for $28 a day and left the car in the garage the entire weekend. We were in close proximity of everything and walked everywhere. We always felt safe even after midnight. The hotel was elegant yet small and historic. The staff was very friendly. We were in smoking rooms on the 10th floor right next to each other in the corner of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and well furnished with safes and mini fridges. Our coffee maker was missing the pot, but we didn't care enough to call to get one. Our room 1005 had some AC issues. The room was HOT. But, our friends' room next door had a fan in it to dry an area of carpet that had been cleaned so we borrowed their fan the entire weekend since their AC was VERY cold and we were perfectly fine. We loved the room so much that we didn't want to move. It was huge!!! It was great place to stay especially on a budget. The rooms were only $107 a night for a weekend. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “"This Is It ! ! !"”
Reviews.Author: rafg8496
Reviews.Content: A great part of having a spectacular vacation is were you stay. The Best Western Plus St. Christopher Hotel was an astounding and quaint place to stay in a great location close to everything! The room we stayed in had exposed brick walls and huge windows from the floor to the ceiling that was so cool and different! Our room was very comfortable and we enjoyed the free wireless Internet and the flat screen television. The general manager was very nice and definitely went out her way to make sure we had everything we needed. She asked us every time we ran into her if there was anything we needed. She brought us extra pillows and was a wealth of useful information. She recommended us to the Place Cafe which was a one minute short walk from the hotel which had a special deal for locals which was not on the menu and something that we would not have not otherwise known about. She made the reservations for us and we saved more than 50% off our bill! The front desk and staff seem really conscientious and concerned to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We truly enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Management Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sharona B
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life had such a bad hotel experience. The hotel itself is just fine, the rooms are a little dark and dingy but reasonable if its your last option and its cheap. Our main problem arose when we had a discrepancy in our reservation. The hotel manager, I believe her name was Maria [--] is the single most rude individual I have ever dealt with in a hotel setting. She was rude to the point of being vindictive. If you're gonna stay in this hotel, DON'T be late for the checkout, DON'T try to check out early, and definitely DON'T do anything that would require you to have to speak to this horrific woman. Luckily, the corporate aspect of Best Western is dependable, and we were able to resolve our problems through the corporate offices and get our money back. Don't ever stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Karishma M
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip slightly last minute. Was very pleased with the hotel. Quaint and cute for a couple, not the best place for families. Great location. Everything is within walking distance. Only negative was the parking costs of $28 a night for valet, however wasn't too big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: Orpllc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with an awesome view of the river. The hotel was very clean and the service was very personal. I was impressed with how willing to help the staff was. Location is steps from the French quarter, casino, aquarium, and many world famous restaurants. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: challeve
Reviews.Content: I love, love, the location, and the exposed brick wall brings a certain charm to an otherwise bland room. The hotel's within walking distance of world-famous Bourbon Street and all of its restaurants and bars, the river, the various street cars, etc. The room was okay: there were no concerns with the linen, the bathroom was also clean. The air conditioner worked very well, but was way too loud for me to get a peaceful night's sleep. My room overlooked Magazine Street, but , having lived in New York City, street noises don't bother me. The hotel might be considered "quaint" by some, but to me it signals the need for an update in decor and furnishings. One thing that really bugged me was the per-night charge for the in-room safe. What's the deal with that? Couldn't they just roll that add-on into the room rate? Nickel-and-diming your guests really isn't a good idea. I also didn't like that the bar wasn't available every evening. It would have been nice to be able to unwind with a cocktail or two in the relative quiet and calm of the hotel lobby. All, in all, not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Charming, but Nice Upgrades...”
Reviews.Author: cdh713
Reviews.Content: Came to NOLA w/friends for a 3-day weekend- friends stayed @ another hotel. For this reason, we did not have to deal w/the parking issue- our friends kept the car w/them. Location was good, bath was VERY clean & nice (newly remodeled?!?), room was kind of odd- shaped but had a very pretty exposed brick wall. Large red stain on the carpet (Hurricane, anyone?...), but in a corner area, so we placed a suitcase over it & forgot about it! We were on one of the lower floors, so there was some street noise... After the 1st night we didn't notice the noise again- the breakfast was kinda sad- I was ok w/it until I went to get milk for my cereal & found little bugs all over the counter. Ugg... Not cool. It WAS really nice that they had a "bar" area in the back of the lobby- nice to have a drink or 2 (or hubby can wait there while us gals finish dressing) before heading out. We came in late one night, & there was a pretty decent- sized group having a really good time! Also, they do allow pets, which is wonderful, but...after walking the area, I do wonder where u would take them to do their "business"... Overall, we would stay here again if our 1st choice (or something new) were not available. For the price & location, however, there are many hotels to choose from-

Reviews.Title: “beautiful space”
Reviews.Author: Dre0303
Reviews.Content: this place is pretty nice for a Best Western - don't get me wrong, but this space is a mixture of many buildings into one hotel and so looks more unique than what I usually get with a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Break in our Journey”
Reviews.Author: aliwithattitude
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before a cruise. 4 adults and 1 toddler. Rooms were quaint. clean and comfortable. Reception staff were realy helpful. air conditioning was wonderful. The Best Best Western Breakfast ever -- amazing choice

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel, AWESOME Location, FAIR Price, POOR Service”
Reviews.Author: Scott-from-Texas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for visiting New Orleans, especially downtown(aquarium, WWII museum, etc.) and the French Quarter. It is just three blocks from the start of Bourbon street and is itself off the main drag of Canal. Crossing over Canal, Magazine street turns into Decatur and is just a 10 minute walk from world-famous Cafe du Monde. The shower water pressure is good, the rooms modern, clean and comfy(recently updated) and the wifi is decent. The free breakfast is the typical pastries, cereal, etc. Since this is in New Orleans, the air conditioning is paramount and I'm happy to say it's capable although a bit loud. The price is right and the location is prime if you book *early* for Mardi Gras(not at all too far from the parades, but not too close where you'll be pushing over people just to get out or people throwing up on you). Now, for my problems with this hotel, it's the service which blows. Since parking seems to be the number 2 industry of New Orleans after tourism, it's hard to find and expensive when you do in downtown New Orleans(for example, there is a restaurant just across the street which charges $20 to valet, just for dinner!). Essentially, you are left with having to valet with the hotel. Well, the first time I asked for my car, the valet brings it around from the garage and scrapes my front, left rim on the curb. You'd think that a valet, who parks and retrieves cars all day, would know where the curb is or at the very least be extra careful not to scrape a rim. On some cars, rims can run $400 each! He then had the presumption to loiter around while I was visibly upset getting into my car like I was going to give him a tip! When we came back from dinner around 11pm(from the excellent but pricey Commander's Palace just two miles away), there was a line of cars in front of the hotel waiting to be parked. We sat in the steet, essentially blocking a lane of traffic, for *20* minutes, no valets to be seen. My wife went in to ask what the deal was and was told they'd be back shortly. So we waited another ten minutes with the other cars in the street til two valets come leisurely strolling down the street from the garage to start parking more cars. After we got back in the hotel, I went straight to the front desk and asked what the reason was for the delay. The desk attendant demurred saying sometimes it just takes a while. I then told her I felt the $28 per day was poorly spent to have to wait 30 minutes and especially blocking a lane of traffic and asked to have this charge reversed for poor service. Her response? In a shining example of poor customer service, she said New Orleans is a big city and there are plenty of other places to park a car while giving her co-workers nearby a sideways glance. I was utterly shocked and then livid at this response. This is *not* customer service, she didn't even try to "fix things" which is the number one rule of customer service. She did not try to apologize, explain, comp, offer a future discount or anything. I have stayed at over 40 Best Westerns across the country(and even the other one just on the other side of the French Quarter 3 years ago) and this was the single most incredibly poor experience I've ever had with a Best Western. So, overall, my advice is to stay here if you really want the good location and a decent nightly rate, but do so with the clear understanding that the staff(and ultimately the onsite management) is likely the worst example possible within the otherwise decent Best Western family of hotels. You are really rolling the dice handing your keys to the valets there(and who knows what negligence they will treat your car with while behind the wheel out of your view!). A giant scrape on my front, left rim is not the souvenir I was expecting to get in New Orleans! Also, the sidewalk is at a high angle to the street, so be careful when opening your door(and watch that the valet is too!) or that will likely get raked over the concrete as well.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare Manager”
Reviews.Author: rosie_priestley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect downtown place to see the city, it looks lovely inside however do not be sucked in!!!!! We were 2 friends male and female travelling together, when we arrived we were met by a lovely man(Quenten) booked us in gave us our room perfect - then we opened the door - we had a kingsize bed!!!! no other bed at all in the room and since Im a married woman and my male friend is gay this was totally unacceptable! Right back down to reception and explained the situation - we had booked a queen queen room which we believed contained 2 queen size beds? Yes thats what the room we had booked was however the hotel was full and they had no other rooms to offer us!!!! the nightmare began!!! There was no roll away bed to offer us and the best he could do was give us extra bedding so my friend could sleep on the floor!!!!! We paid for 2 beds and my friend had to spend the night on the floor - great start!!!! We were assured this could be easily sorted out at 9am when the manager was back in Next morning after a very uncomfortable night for my friend on the floor we went at 10am expecting to be able to speak with the manager - was met by a very hostile receptionist who informed us of 3 different time the manager would be in work. when i questioned she had given me 3 different times, without even allowing me to finish what i was saying she shouted at me - erm i thought we were the guests in the hotel and they were providing us with a service??? We were given another room at 11.30 however still didnt see the manager of the hotel until about 2.30pm and then our niightmare really began. She told us we got what we paid for - we were really shocked since we were holding a booking confirmation that stated we had booked a room with 2 beds - OK the manager said we have sorted it now whats the problem? even more shocked now we explained we had paid for 2 beds and only received one, she then said she would speak to Bookit.com and see if she could get us a refund for the night we only had 1 bed - ok we thought thats fair enough and we went about our holiday. The next morning we got up late and went down to reception about 10.30 to see who were had been told was the manager the day before however she was sat in the lobby on a sofa talking to someone - so as not to be rude and interrupt her we decided to go out and see her later, however as we reached the door of the hotel she looked up and shouted across the hotel "Bookit.com said they would refund you 20%" I was so embarrassed by this outburst in front of other guessed I just said "thank you and left" however when we spoke to Bookit.com later that day they said they didnt say they would refund anything. We were feeling quite upset by this time and decided to contact Best Western Customer Services who informed us the person we had been speak to (the manager) was not the manager at all so things got worse - we got the name of the General Manager of the hotel and spoke to her and then things really did get bad. She screamed at us on the phone to check out of the hotel - oh my god I really couldnt believe this was happening and really believed there was no way things could get any worse however they did. After the General Manager had told us how sorry she was for what she said the very next morning there was a banging on our door like there was a fire in the building since we had put the "do not disturb" sign on our door we really did think there must be some sort of emergency that someone would bang on our door so loudly and with the sign there. My friend opened the door and a woman burst through it and right away began shouting at me - I was in total shock and had no idea who this woman was! I asked very calmly excuse me who are you? she informed me she was in fact the General Manager and wanted us out of her hotel by 11.30am at this point it was actually 11.45am when i asked why she informed me that I had complained that the iron in the room was not working right!!!! We choose to ignore this person however it did have a very big impact on the rest of our stay - we feared to go out of the hotel and leave our belongings in case they were not there on our return, we feared to speak to any of the staff in case this woman became irrational again and our room was never cleaned from that day on - to get clean towels we had to go to reception and ask for them daily and anything else we didnt dare ask for. So if you want somewhere that looks nice on the surface, you get screamed at by the staff and you fear for your things then this is the place for you. However if you want somewhere you will receive polite professional staff then go somewhere else and I have not exaggerated any of this if anything I have not expressed just how bad it really was

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Spot”
Reviews.Author: moonmanphoto
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough nice things about this location and its staff. It was not the Waldorff but for the price we were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiledown
Reviews.Content: Hotel is with in walking distance of French Quarter. Very nice, clean and nice atmosphere. Staff friendly. Ate at a 24 hour resturant called "Daisy Dukes". My daughter tried Alliagator Po Boy. It was very good. Great pricing. all ohter entrees were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable, and well located.”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu10
Reviews.Content: You won't be dissapointed staying at this little gem as long as you understand a few things ahead of time. First, you will have to have a valet park your car for $28 a day. Not all rooms have a window, and smoking is allowed in this hotel. Your room will be small, but stylishly appointed. Housekeeping was fantastic. The room was one of the cleanest that we have stayed in. The complimentary breakfast is better than average. The main reason why you sleep here is the location. The St. Christopher Hotel is perfect for sightseeing in NOLA. It's a quiet and safe hotel downtown within walking distance from riverfront, the casino, the French Quarter, and the streetcars. We didn't get our car out once during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!!!”
Reviews.Author: DreaminOfBeingInNOLA
Reviews.Content: Only great experiences with the lobby/housekeeping staff! Hotel is nice and clean, though not overly-lavish, and located near the Quarter. Asked for a quiet room with a window (not all rooms have them) at time of on-line reservation, and was given a nice quiet room on the 12th floor. (Note: We made reservations for a smoking room--make sure your reservation reflects your preference here.) Used our Wells Fargo points which made our stay most affordable. Not able to comment regarding complimentary breakfast as we are late-risers. Housekeeping staff was very accommodating as we never left the room early in the a.m. Upon leaving our room for the day, we informed lobby personnel that housekeeping could go in and clean, and our room was nice and clean upon our return in the evenings. Hotel can also provide a nice bag of extra towels hanging from your doorknob, which is a nice touch. Note that if you're using the Internet (free here where other hotels may charge a fee) and it remains idle for more than 20 mins. (Mac user), you will need to login again. Also was not able to logon to internet with iTouch, even after talking with tech support. Complimentary use of the printers in their business center on the 2nd floor was a plus. Nice central location close to a number of streetcar lines (Canal/St. Charles), as well as the City bus that goes down Magazine Street which will drop you off close to the WW II Museum, amongst other attractions, as well as taking you to the Magazine St. shopping district (boutique shopping/antiques/restaurants) for $1.25 fare. Also close to the streetcar that runs along the Mississippi River which will take you as far as Jackson Square/French Market with a short 2-3 block walk to Frenchman Street for the jazz clubs. Hotel is also a close walk to the Riverwalk indoor mall, Harrah's casino and the ferry to Algiers. All in all, a good value for the money and optimally located!

Reviews.Title: “I don't like arguing over a pet policy or having a lack of privacy.”
Reviews.Author: AJWISLER
Reviews.Content: The St. Christopher's Best Western in New Orleans is downtown and in a great location for touring the city. You do have to pay $27.00 to have your vehicle valet parked, so keep that in mind. But our problems were with the hotel staff. When we called to make reservations, we asked if pets were allowed. The rep at the 1-800 Best Western number said the fee was $22 a night for pets. I told him we had two dogs. He said that that would be $22 for the pet fee for the one night we booked. However, upon check out, the bill showed that I had been charged $20 per pet on my credit card, a total of $40.00. I told the desk clerk this was not what I had been told when I made my reservation. She called over the manager who came to talk with me fifteen minutes later. The manager argued that the Best Western website states the pet policy is $20 per night. It doesn't. For this hotel, it says to call to verify the pet fee. Disgusted, and realizing that the manager would not budge and take off the extra $20, my husband and I left the hotel. I also told the manager that our room had been booked as one with a city view and all we got was a view of a brick wall and that in the morning, a maintenance man walked on the ledge right outside our third floor window and looked in on us! The manager wasn't bothered or apologetic. After our trip, I posted a complaint at the Best Western site and heard from someone from the hotel. She refused to refund my $20.00. I do not like to complain. But this, to me, was downright rude. Since I was told the pet fee was only $22, then charged $20 for each pet and then when I argued was told if I had only looked up the policy on the website, I would have known it, frustrates me. And in addition, having a hotel maintenance man looking in on us from a window was just creepy! Too bad the Best Western St. Christopher doesn't have a satisfaction guarantee like the Hampton Inns do. Had the hotel corrected their mistake, I would be so much happier. Yes, this did affect our last day in New Orleans. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: CultureBuffs
Reviews.Content: Our Room was reletively clean, but it didn't have ANY WINDOWS ! We asked for 1 Queen Sized Bed and we were given 2 Doubles. Unfortunately there was a Conference in town and those guests apparently took priority. The Breakfasts were decent and enough to start an early day of sightseeing. If you're not at this Hotel to be pampered and you just need a Room to sleep in, then this is the place. It's clean and affordable. End of Story.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent”
Reviews.Author: Stellabella54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Jazz Festival and what a great find. Located right off Canal Street a short walk to the French Quarter. The rooms were not fancy but neat and clean, beds comfortable, however I would recommend paying the small upcharge ($20) for a room with a window. The staff was accomodating and friendly. Breakfast and great coffee every morning in the lobby/bar area. The bartender was WONDERFUL, we loved her. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but cramped”
Reviews.Author: scasci
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for 1 night in New Orleans and selected the St. Christopher based on other reviews. It was "OK" but I wouldn't stay there again. It is an older hotel that has been refurbished and it has much more character than Best Western chain hotels. It also has TINY rooms. We got a king room, and the bed literally took up the entire room. There was nowhere to set down an open suitcase! There was also no closet in which to store clothes and the suitcase. The location is decent, 1/2 block from Canal Street on the opposite side from the French Quarter. The room was quiet until a delivery truck started beeping right outside our window at about 5 a.m. The breakfast buffet was disappointing. I have hypoglycemia so was hoping for some form of eggs or other protein, but it was nothing but carbs. The front desk staff were absolutely delightful, as was the lady manning the breakfast station. Valet parking is available but expensive (I think we paid $30 for the night). It is off premises, so you have to wait awhile for your car to be delivered. The entire hotel is beautifully decorated and extremely clean, the public areas are roomy enough, but our guest room was truly claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel With Room 205 being the best.”
Reviews.Author: LoveDoug5916
Reviews.Content: We traveled with pets and although we both smoked, pets were not welcome above the 2nd floor which was understandable since the room was adjacent to the lobby atrium and smoking rooms were above the 2nd floor only. Great hostess, great access to the French Quarter and Harras Casino, Starbucks Coffee (in Harras), restaurants, parks for the dogs and everything a body could possibly need. We tried to stay another night but with the French Quarter Festival that proved impossible but either my partner or myself will definitely be staying at this friendly hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: peacefulkitty
Reviews.Content: We booked our room here about 5 months in advance along with another family, just a couple of nights before our cruise. The front desk was advised our flight was delayed & we would be an hour late, but I think they gave our room away anyway. Hard to say because the front desk lady actually took her phone & left the room & refused to tell us why we weren't accommodated despite our paid reservation. After I called corporate customer care they tried to book us another room & paid for the cab to get there. They said we could come back the next day & still our second night, but we refused after our treatment at St. Christopher. Then at check out, St. Christopher refused to pay for the other hotel they had shunted us to. We contacted corporate customer care again, but no one from Best Western would take responsibility and pay the bill. We ended up paying over $160 for a trashy motel a half mile away just so we could get out of NOLA and enjoy our cruise. We were promised a follow-up conversation regarding the bill, which never came. I tried again today, but Best Western corporate & St. Christopher refused to take responsibility for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but this hotel has issues!”
Reviews.Author: Sarsy47
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited New Orleans in March 2011 for a girls trip from the U.K and because we chose to arrive the day after Mardi Gras there was little choice of accommodation available. We realised we were lucky to get a room so close to the French Quarter. I cannot fault the location, a short walk to the main areas of the French Quarter and Bourbon Street, there is a handy shop on the corner and a cash dispenser next door. The hotel itself is clean and the decor although in need of a refurb is fine. Some of the ladies on reception were delightful, very helpful and pleasant but on a couple of days not so. Just beware of the generator/air conditioner noise, mentioned in other reviews, very noisy even with ear plugs, can't say whether all the rooms are like this but for us the sleep quality was bad. Also don't rely on your wake up call being at the right time and check your bill, it took us 3 goes to get a correct bill as we had someone else's parking charges on it . I guess you get what you pay for and actually it was good value so I wouldn't say don't stay here because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Room--ok; breakfast--mediocre; service--terrible”
Reviews.Author: M1zz0u
Reviews.Content: Upon checking out of my room early one morning, I was presented with a bill with incorrect charges. The desk worker on duty told me she could not change my bill, highlighted the incorrect charges (aka 100% local tax for 4 of my 5 nights), and told me a corrected version would be emailed to me. Five days later after ~4 phone calls, the incorrect total is still on my credit card, and I have not received a corrected statement. Ten days later after more phone calls, I filed a complaint with Best Western Corporate and disputed the charge with my credit card company. Twelve days later, I received a corrected version of my statement via fax. Finally, fourteen days later, my credit card was credited for the incorrect amount. If you want to put up with this level of incompetence and hassle, by all means stay at this hotel while enjoying wonderful New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sheneka
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in s great location; walking distance of where you want to be. The room was clean. The shower I'd always the test and this bathroom and shower exceeded my expectations. The shower head was wonderful! Taking a shower felt like I was getting a massage! The only downfall of the hotel is that there is no on-site parking. Unless you want to struggle to find your own parking, you will have to cough up $28 a day for them to valet your car. Overall I will definitely return here got the stay!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS St. Christopher Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 114 Magazine Street, New Orleans, LA 70130
